subtitleNullable: Contains every Pokemon type from generations 1 to 9
descriptionNullable:
This data was generated using pokeapi.co and custom formatted using a python script. All images are 64x64 with no Alpha channel with a white background. It contains multiple versions of each Pokemon spanning all generations. The images are labeled in the prefix of the filename `X_` where X is the number in the Pokedex. After about 1024 the numbers are not accurate to the Pokedex as those are variations on existing Pokemon but they are labeled in order to make label generation easier. 

The accompanied `pokemon_labels.csv` is exactly that; it's a one line `csv` file where the number corresponds directly to the image in the directory. 

`pokemon_label_with_titles.csv` is a CSV formatted with the columns `image` and `label` where image corresponds to  the image name in the images directory. 

This was mainly tested with my custom machine learning framework in swift:  https://github.com/wvabrinskas/Neuron 
but it should work with really any machine learning framework
title: Complete Gen 1 - 9 Pokemon Image Dataset
subtitle: Contains every Pokemon type from generations 1 to 9
description:

It contains multiple versions of each Pokemon spanning all generations. The images are labeled in the prefix of the filename `X_` where X is the number in the Pokedex. After about 1024 the numbers are not accurate to the Pokedex as those are variations on existing Pokemon but they are labeled in order to make label generation easier. 

The accompanied `pokemon_labels.csv` is exactly that; it's a one line `csv` file where the number corresponds directly to the image in the directory. 

`pokemon_label_with_titles.csv` is a CSV formatted with the columns `image` and `label` where image corresponds to  the image name in the images directory.
